[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/digest.rs] [Protocol] [Commitment Binding] Can an attacker open a commitment to two different ID sets, breaking the binding property? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/digest.rs] [Protocol] [Commitment Hiding] Does the commitment scheme properly hide the ID set, or can an attacker deduce IDs from the digest? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/digest.rs] [Protocol] [Knowledge Soundness] Does the proof system ensure that the prover actually knows the ID set, or can proofs be generated without this knowledge? (High)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/digest.rs] [Protocol] [Simulation Attack] Can an attacker simulate valid proofs without access to the secret tau value? (Critical)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/digest.rs] [Protocol] [Trusted Setup] Does the setup in new() create a proper trusted setup, or could the setup process leak tau? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/digest.rs] [Protocol] [Multi-Party Setup] Can this system be extended to multi-party trusted setup, or is single-party setup a vulnerability? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/digest.rs] [Side-Channel] [Timing Attack on Verification] Does verify_pf() execute in constant time regardless of proof validity, or can timing distinguish valid from invalid proofs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/digest.rs] [Side-Channel] [Cache Timing on MSM] Can cache-timing attacks during MSM operations leak scalar values used in proof computation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/digest.rs] [Side-Channel] [Branch Prediction] Do conditional branches leak information about secret values through branch prediction side channels? (Low)
